column4: okay guys, I finally got ubuntu installed and working... now how do I get my windows to work once again :)
it begins to boot, but then freezes on load
it should just work. did you have windows on the first hard drive, and the first partition?
yes, however I had to change the boot order in the bios, so it thinks "ubuntu = hd0" and windows = "hd1"   (even tho windoiws is on hda, and linux is on hdb)
it is a file, if you have a gui editor, you can edit it. the file is at /boot/grub/menu.lst
yes i know, I was wondering if there was an automated tool available =\
why did you have to switch it in bios?
my mbr is messed up on hda (windows)
you should have installed grub into mbr, and it would have done it.
I tried that option, no luck
a multitude of errors occured with that
then it... freezes up (well, the _ is still blinking)
that is over my head, mostly.

I do not think there is a grub way to do it. I would reinstall everything on the proper hard disk, windows has to be on first partition of first hard disk for it to load. I even think this problem is related to windows, not to grub.
but again, I could be wrong.
=\ k (and I dont think it has to be on the first disk, ive had linux on my large drive before / win on small one)
